newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela foreign reserves jump to $16.651 bln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela foreign reserves jump to $16.651 bln.

text.p: Venezuela's total foreign reserves jumped $857 million, or 5.4 percent, in the week to June 30 to $16.651 billion, according to new figures released by the central bank.
Reserves were up from $15.794 billion on June 23, the bank's latest weekly bulletin of indicators showed.

The bank did not say why reserves had jumped, but analysts said it may have been due to payment of some of the $2 billion in bids Venezuela received from the third oil auction round which ended June 6. Successful bidders had 90 days to pay.

Since the start of the year, foreign reserves have risen $1.472 billion, or 9.7 percent. Reserves rose $5.5 billion, or 57 percent, last year to $15.179 billion and government officials have forecast they will grow to $20 billion by the end of 1997.
